26460820.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific
26460820.theme: Public expenditure, financial management and procurement

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Nanguang Railway Project
            for China were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk
            to development outcome was low or negligible, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: unified control
            over railway program development, project design, financing,
            and implementation is a recipe for overall project success
            even when the Bank’s financial contribution is relatively
            marginal. The use of agglomeration benefits is essential for
            structuring a railway project as an increasing number of
            companies became more closely connected. A large and linear
            infrastructure investment projects calls for: (a) a good
            preliminary design; (b) strict control over compliance with
            standards and specifications and quality control; (c)
            reliable and responsible contractors; (d) meticulous
            planning of activities; and (e) timely land acquisition.
            Understanding and addressing passenger needs in the context
            of door-to-door connectivity and adequate urban planning
            will be critical to achieve the full impact of the high
            speed rail network.

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the NanGuang Railway
            Project is to provide additional transport capacity and
            reduce transport time between the less developed western
            region of southwest China and the relatively more developed
            Pearl River Delta region. The change is to reflect in the
            project documents the incorporation of the NanGuang Railway
            Company Preparation Group as the Nanning-Guangzhou Railway
            Company Limited and the GuiGuang Preparation Group as the
            Guiyang- Guangzhou Railway Company Limited. This change,
            anticipated in the original project appraisal document,
            reflects the creation of new legal entities, as part of the
            project implementation structure, in line with the practice
            in other recent railway projects in China.
